name: Art Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a suite room which was fab as it had our own large private balcony with comfy chairs, lovely to sit out on and have a beer at night. The room was spotless and decor of the hotel was very arty ,relaxing and pleasing on the eye.
reviews.title: Fantastic-highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were fabulous so unbelievelaby helpful, friendly and kind. We received an easter gift, a bottle of wine, beers and even left with a bottle of ouzo. On arrival you are offered a drink and cakes and given a detailed overview of Athens which was very helpful.Internet access was free also.
reviews.title: Excellent service, beautiful room, perfect place to stay in Athens!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise it is near the metro omonia which makes everywhere easily accessible , a 5 min trip takes you near to the plaka and the acropolis, otherwise it is 20 min walk max.
reviews.title: 7 nights at the Art Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A warm and friendly hotel which we highly recommend.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

likes.liked: — The staff and the hotel design

reviews.title: High art and high living in Athens at the Art Hotel
reviews.text: What a wonderful, warm place to stay in Athens! Family-run with two sisters running it, we think. My husband and I stayed here at the start and finish of our vacation - in the middle, we traveled throughout Egypt.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for a week and had a wonderful time. The staff at the hotel, particularly the receptionists were the most pleasant and helpful people in any hotel that we have visited. They welcomed us, not only on the first day but every time we returned to the hotel, they gave us drinks and explained the places of interest in Athens and gave excellent information on where to go, eat and drink. Nothing was too much trouble. The room was fine and the breakfast buffet served until 11.00am and had all you could want. The area is a bit run down but there was an excellent shop on the corner that sold the best chocolate cakes we have ever eaten. The hotel was just 5 minutes walk from the metro and we would definitely recommend it to visitors to Athens.We would like to thank the staff for helping us to have a lovely holiday, Sue and Cliffy
reviews.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Athens

reviews.text: We just came back from a very enjoyable stay at the Art Hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive points:
reviews.title: Great Location to see the sights

likes.disliked: — I would have prefered a proper shower cubicle to shower attachemnt to a bath

reviews.title: A good choice
reviews.text: - we booked a suite on the top floor, since we are a family of 4 and this is one of the few hotels in Athens which will allow two extra cots in the room. The suite was very large, the four of us were very comfortable. Even better was the HUGE balcony. We bought drinks at the nearby supermarket and enjoyed the balcony every evening!!

reviews.title: Gem of a hotel
reviews.text: - the room was very clean. Bathroom equipped with a spa bath, which the children enjoyed very much after a long day of walking
I agree with previous reviews.
reviews.title: Good location - not disappointed

reviews.text: The hotel's location is excellent for first-time Athens visitors. The helpful staff (Zoe and Melinda among others) tried very hard to please. The home atmosphere downstairs and the breakfast buffet are very good. Arriving in early afternoon, we were given rooms to choose from. Ours does not have much of a view (it overlooks the ruin of a rooftop of an abandoned adjacent building) but is quiet.
reviews.title: Art Hotel understands the meaning of customer service!

reviews.text: My biggest complaint is with the bathroom - it needs more venting and the glass (opaque) door is a nuisance.
reviews.title: Marvellous staff attention

likes.liked: — The friendly attitude of the staff
likes.disliked: — The noise at night from city traffic

reviews.text: Firstly a small point: twirlgirl has made her review against the wrong hotel as there is certainly no view of the Acropolis from this hotel!
reviews.title: Great staff, rooms and location!

reviews.text: I chose this hotel thanks to everyones great comments on this site, and after staying there for 3 nights in late April (99€/night) I have to agree with everyone. On arrival the staff eally go out of their way to make you feel welcome, offering you a drink and sit you down with a map to help to get your bearings and plan your time in Athens.
reviews.title: Excellent city centre hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Art Hotel was a very nice. The receptionist and staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful. Upon arrival a welcome drink of your choice was served. They explained the area and gave a helpful map. The room and bathroom were modern and clean. Breakfast was excellent and plentiful. Use the Ovmonia metro stop to get to the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful gem
The BEST people at the GREATEST hotel, a must stay
reviews.text: The only negative is that it is located on a VERY bust street.

Honestly, this was the greatest place ever to stay, we actually extended our stop in Athens so that we could stay there longer. The staff is so incredible, they would do anything to make sure you are perfectly happy and comfortable, the nicest people i have ever met. This place defines amazing service. I walked in to check in, and was offered a welcome drink, they let me choose the room i wanted to stay in because there was availability, and a great breakfast spread. To show just how amazing they are, not only did they book our hotel in the next town we were headed for and got us a great deal, one night we were tired and wanted to eat somewhere close so they ordered us food in, and replated everything so that we wouldnt have to step outside. If you like feeling like you're coming home at the end of a long day touring the city, stay here. Great rooms, great location in the heart of the city, and the nicest people I have ever met. Please stay here, its the greatest! We LOVE Art Hotel Athens!
reviews.title: The Best Hotel to Stay in Athens!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights on our trip to Greece and ended up coming back again! We have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world and for the price were expecting a mediocre experience....boy were we wrong!!!!! I have never experienced such attentive service. Anything we wanted, needed, or didn't even know we needed was taken care of. The staff was incredible, helping with absolutely anything from laundry to food to tours....whatever it was, it was taken care of! The breakfast is excellent and the rooms and nice and clean. The value is absolutely unbeatable and if you are the kind of traveler that likes to feel as if you are coming home at the end of the day, this place is for you. They felt like family and in the middle of a noisy, exciting, energetiC city it was the perfect place to feel comfortable and relaxed. 10, 10, 10!!!
reviews.title: The warmest attention in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very gentle people attending at the hotel. If you go for tourist they show you what you need to see without wasting your time, and in case you go for business is the best place to rest after a hard working day.
reviews.title: Great Price and very attentive staff

likes.liked: — Size of the room and staff

description: The Athens Art Hotel is 4-star new elegant boutique hotel, operating in a renovated neoclassical building of 1930, situated in the centre of Athens, within walking distance from the national archaeological museum and Omonoia square. The 30 guest rooms and suites are designed and furnished one by one, depending on the room shape, the traffic flow, the focal point and the lighting.
